title: IDE build tests with progen
body:
I have separated some of the exporter logic in project.py to project_api.py. I did this because I wanted to use some of that functionality in the new build_test script. build_test allows testing of ide builds (currently supports iar, uvision, and uv5) using progen. 

build_test examples:

builds blinky for iar and k64f

```
python build_test.py -i iar -t MBED_BLINKY -m K64F
```

build blinky and Hello World test for all targets on all (supported) ides

```
python build_test.py -t MBED_BLINKY MBED_10
```

builds all tests (current default is just blinky but you can specify more with -t) for all progen targets on all ides 

```
python build_test.py 
```

Revision of [this](https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/2080) PR.

title: Suppress warnings about deprecated __ldrex/strex
body:
Suppress warnings about ARMCC warnings about the __ldrex and __strex
intrinsics to match CMSIS 5.

title: Rebuild sources if configuration is changed
body:
This commit adds a check for configuration data changes. If a change in
configuration data is detected, all the sources in the tree are rebuilt.

This is a fix for #2073. #2162 was originally proposed as a fix, but it
was agreed that `--preinclude` is a more convenient way to include
configuration data, since it can be used to change the behaviour of
source files that don't include "mbed_config.h" directly, which is a big
advantage when importing 3rd party source trees. Compared to #2162, this
commit has the disadvantage of rebuilding all the source files if a
configuration change is detected, but it was agreed that the advantage
of using `--preinclude` outweighs the disadvantage of the increased
compilation time.

title: [toolchains]Abstractify the mbedToolchain base class.
body:
This enforces the expected api of a toolchain at instantiation time and documents the API that an inheritor of mbedToolchain should implement. It also adds a test that all exposed toolchains conform to the API.

This is the first part of my master plan to test the toolchains more.

title: Exporter - TARGET[] list - is supported call for uvision/iar
body:
There might be a slowdown due to TARGETS in the tools. It used to be a list in the python file, but now using progen, to keep it backward compatible, there was an addition to ask progen if a target is supported. 

We should have a look how much time it takes and if we can improve by catching targets either on progen side or here in this codebase. This definitely takes some time as we got a lot of targets, and many of those are not defined yet in progen for instance.

This is valid for uvision/iar.

Reference: https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/master/tools/export/uvision4.py#L40

cc @theotherjimmy @sarahmarshy @screamerbg

title: [GCC] Multiple optimization issue.
body:
I tried to generate Makefile project with mbed-lib ver.122
as follows:

```
python tools/build.py -m NUCLEO_F030R8 -t GCC_ARM -c -v
python tools/project.py -m NUCLEO_F030R8 -i gcc_arm -n MBED_11
```

In the Makefile generated, multiple optimization options by default, 
"-O2" and "-Os" are both activated during compilation.

"-O2" option should be removed.

dinau

title: Export NDEBUG symbol for debug builds
body: It is a useful convention to have for writing code that does not get built during a release build.

title: Remove floating point formatting in newlib nano
body:
Remove special case targets which have floating point enabled in
Newlib Nano from gcc.py.  To enable floating point printf/scanf
for a target configure it to use the 'standard' default build in
targets.json rather than 'small'.

title: Remove ldrex and strex from RTOS with ARMCC
body:
ARMCC has marked the __strex and __strex intrinsics as deprecated so
turn them off for this compiler.

title: Change how the config system is used
body:
This commit address the issue presented in
https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/issues/2073. Previously, mbed_config.h
was automatically included by the toolchain. With this change, all the
sources that need "mbed_config.h" need to include it manually. However,
"mbed.h" now includes "mbed_config.h", so configuration data is
automatically available to sources that include "mbed.h".

With this change, even if there's no configuration data in the project
being built, an empty "mbed_config.h" is generated by the build system.

This change looks big, but most of it is an almost complete reversal of
https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/1975.

This is likely a breaking change, and needs to be properly
communicated.

title: [Tools] Replace in memap CSV report fields
body:
## Changes
- This change is clean-up after #2047 (_Add memory usage summary for test building_)
- In code of memory usage summary columns were shortened and names changed a bit,
  see [here](https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/2047/files?w=1#diff-f9cb941bde5647a5763e18fc220efc51R410)
  - Change was done to make columns not so wide for user.
  - This change did not propagate to JSON and CSV reports generated by memap script.
- There is a need to align memap CSV report fields (summary columns) with what
  is in code now. This discrepancy may create problems when generating reports
  in the future. All columns should have the same name.
- memap CSV summary fields names changes:
  - `total_static_ram` -> `static_ram`
  - `allocated_heap` -> `heap`
  - `allocated_stack` -> `stack`

See example of discrepancy:
- `total_static_ram` vs `static_ram`
- `allocated_heap` vs `heap`
- `allocated_stack` vs `stack`
## Current implementation outputs

What is in code and presented with prettytable:

```
+----------------------------------------+--------+-----------+------------+-------+-------+-----------+-------------+
| name                                   | target | toolchain | static_ram | stack |  heap | total_ram | total_flash |
+----------------------------------------+--------+-----------+------------+-------+-------+-----------+-------------+
| tests-mbed_drivers-c_strings           | K64F   | GCC_ARM   |      11468 | 32768 | 65540 |    109776 |       74182 |
| tests-mbed_drivers-callback            | K64F   | GCC_ARM   |      11980 | 32768 | 65540 |    110288 |       88406 |
| tests-mbedmicro-rtos-mbed-threads      | K64F   | GCC_ARM   |      11468 | 32768 | 65540 |    109776 |       75918 |
| tests-mbedmicro-rtos-mbed-timer        | K64F   | GCC_ARM   |      10788 | 32768 | 65540 |    109096 |       68534 |
+----------------------------------------+--------+-----------+------------+-------+-------+-----------+-------------+
```

vs CSV:

```
total_static_ram,allocated_heap,allocated_stack,total_ram,total_flash
10788,65540,32768,109096,67486
```

vs memstats_map.JSON:

``` json
[
    {
        "module": "Fill",
        "size": {
            ".data": 4,
            ".bss": 2257,
            ".text": 173
        }
    },

    {
        "summary": {
            "total_flash": 67486,
            "allocated_stack": 32768,
            "total_static_ram": 10788,
            "total_ram": 109096,
            "allocated_heap": 65540
        }
    }
]
```

title: Initialization steps in toolchains
body:
This PR is a follow-up of "Fix issue #2124: IAR no rtos #2129" for other tooochains.
jamike analysis explained that mbed_sdk_init needs to be called once at the right time (after ram initialization and before C++ object creation) - this PR aims to fulfill this same requirement for the supported toolchains (gcc / arm / arm) and also in case of ARM + rtos configuration. 

Once this series is applied, few workarounds' can be removed from STM32 drivers.

title: [tools-build,make,test] Add bash tab completion
body:
In particular all options should now tab complete and the parameters
to -t and -m should tab complete after sourcing tools/tabcomplete.sh
in bash.

The tools must be run directly using `tools/build.py -t <tab>` or similar
for tab completion to work correctly.

title: C99/C++98 standard compliance
body:
Currently, there are no barriers in place for using compiler extensions. This makes it difficult to know when code is inherently unportable. Allowing compiler extensions hurts reproducibility across toolchains.

From previous discussions these appear to be our target standards:
- C99
- C++98 (C++11 is unsupported in IAR)

Here is a quick checklist of what is needed to bring mbed up to compliance:
- [ ] strict c99/c++98 flags in gcc
- [ ] strict c99/c++98 flags in armc5
- [ ] strict c99/c++98 flags in iar
- [ ] compile in gcc
- [ ] compile in armc5
- [ ] compile in iar
- [ ] warning free in gcc
- [ ] warning free in armc5
- [ ] warning free in iar

Previous issue: ARMmbed/mbed-os#241

title: More verrbose errors for JSON parsing
body:
This commit adds information about the location of problematic JSON
files when reporting a JSON parsing error.

Before this commit:

```
[ERROR] Expecting property name: line 7 column 9 (char 188)
```

After this commit:

```
Error parsing 'core/mbed_lib.json':
[ERROR] Expecting property name: line 7 column 9 (char 188)
```

title: fix for the RWW errors while using Storage driver for internal flash on K64F
body:
fixes https://github.com/ARMmbed/configuration-store/issues/21

Read-while-write errors may occur when there is a read/fetch on a bank of
internal flash while an erase/program operation to the same bank is active.

The possibility of read-while-write errors depends on the application's span
of internal-flash.

In the trivial (and also the default) case when this boundary is set to lie at
the junction between the two banks of internal flash (i.e. BLOCK1_START_ADDR),
there is _no_ possibility of read-while-write. In the more common case, when
the system doesn't reserve all of BLOCK1 for the flash driver, there exists
the possibility of read-while-write.

To avoid this problem for the common case (above), we enforce the following:
- Force synchronous mode of execution in the storage_driver.
- Disable interrupts during erase/program operations. This prevents the
  execution of arbitrary user-code which might access flash.
- Ensure all code and data structures used in the storage driver execute
  out of RAM. Refer to __RAMFUNC which allows for this.

We assume that DEVICE_STORAGE_CONFIG_HARDWARE_MTD_START_ADDR is the boundary between application and this driver. This is used to make a compile-time choice to enforce the above-mentioned conditions.

@kjbracey-arm @simonqhughes @meriac 

notify: @marcuschangarm

title: KSDK2 - set ADC mux before taking measurement
body:
Set the channel mux before taking a reading rather than on
initialization.  This allows ADC pins on both mux A and B to be used in
the same application.

title: Enable warnings for non-conforming c99/c++98 code
body:
This will help moving towards more strictly conforming code, which will help reduce problems with portability across compilers.

This pr is currently gcc only. If anyone knows the appropriate flags for armc5 or iar, let me know.

related: https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/issues/241

title: Add config option for stdio baud rate
body:
Adds `core.stdio-baud-rate configuration` option. Defaults to 9600 for backwards compatibility. Mirrors the `core.stdio-convert-newlines` option.

This came up in an offline discussion again. The currently supported mechanism for changing baud rate is through the SerialBase::baud member function. This works great for implementing drivers, but has shown to be limiting for applications, where the owner of the serial connection is less well defined.

Previous discussions:
- https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/issues/1969
- https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/1988
- https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/issues/449

cc @sg-, @bogdanm, @0xc0170

title: MultiTech Dragonfly: Export project to IAR, the binary file cannot run on it
body:
Hi, there,

I am trying some example programs on the MultiTech Dragonfly. When I use the online compiler, and get the binary files to download them into the board by USD Disk mode, they work well. but I exported these projects to my IAR V7.4 compiler, and built these projects to binary files, downloaded them into the board as the same way, there were nothing displaying on the serial terminal. However I can use the IAR download and debug, these programs can run well.

I do not know what differences are between these binary files from online compiler and my IAR compiler.

Thanks, Henry

title: [tools-build,make,test] Disallow parent of repo as --build args
body:
Resolves #2081 by making any parent of the repo (or the repo dir itself)
passed to --build fail at argument parsing time.

title: [Project.py] Make -i and -m optional
body: Resolves #2135

title: Added flow control for K64F
body:
This commit adds hardware flow control capabilities for the K64F family
of MCUs. This is a backport of these commits:

https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-hal-ksdk-mcu/commit/9bfcfd0572d1835a889779515a3b612262785a46
https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-hal-frdm-k64f/commit/77042cc9453c91957b04e9bd200a2dd928723e5a

with a few changes:
- since the current version of KSDK doesn't seem to have APIs for
  manipulating the flow control settings, we change the peripheral
  registers directly.
- updated pin maps for RTS/CTS in accordance to the K64F datasheet.

title: Add debug symbols to release builds (all toolchains)
body:
Add debug symbols to release builds in all toolchains. Including symbols in the builds significantly improves the debugging experience for all users because they can now relate the program execution to lines of source code rather than just plain assembly while using debugging tools such as GDB. This makes it significantly easier to identify bugs and issues in applications.
Note: Adding debug symbols will increase the size of the resulting elf file produced by the compiler, but should not have an impact in the binary that is flashed onto the target device.

title: [target.json - progen] changing a wrong config
body: ARCH_MAX has a STM32F407 mcu

title: Remove macro for operators. Enable these as default behavior
body: By default, APIs with overloaded operators are enabled. Remove the macro that was gating this but enabled by default in the header file.

title: [KSDK2_MCUS] Fix I2C slave address
body:
I2C slave address on TARGET_KSDK2_MCUS is set as `(user_input_address | 1) << 1`.However, the bit shift is needless.So, this commit removes it.

(My mbed account is `mrks`.I have accepted `contributor_agreement`.)

title: project.py - changed (unlogical?) behaviour
body:
Some commits before it was possible to call:

```
project.py -S
```

to get the supported matrix of MCUs and IDEs.
Now I get:

```
usage: project.py [-h] -m MCU -i IDE [-c] [-p PROGRAM] [-n PROGRAM] [-b] [-L]
                  [-S] [-E] [--source SOURCE_DIR] [-D MACROS]
project.py: error: argument -m/--mcu is required
```

and have to call e.g.

```
project.py -S -m ARCH_MAX -i uvision5
```

to get this tables.
The same error is generated with :

```
project.py -L
```

build.py and make.py with option -S are working as before.

title: RTOS does not work on STM32L476RG
body: Blinky stops working if i link with RTOS.

title: prepend common .c files with mbed_
body: More rename and updates coming but doing this in smaller bits

title: NRF51 boards without 32K crystal fails to boot
body:
On the nrf51 the function `os_tick_init` in `us_ticker.c` initializes the low frequency clock to use a 32 KHz crystal and waits for it to stabilize.  If this crystal is not present the the device will hang forever waiting for stabilization.  One board which exhibits this problem is the `micro:bit`.

To support all boards there needs to be some mechanism to select the internal RC oscillator if no external crystal is present.

As a test, selecting the internal RC oscillator allows the `micro:bit` to boot and run.

Before:

```
int os_tick_init (void)
{
    NRF_CLOCK->LFCLKSRC            = (CLOCK_LFCLKSRC_SRC_Xtal << CLOCK_LFCLKSRC_SRC_Pos);
...
```

With:

```
int os_tick_init (void)
{
    NRF_CLOCK->LFCLKSRC            = (CLOCK_LFCLKSRC_SRC_RC << CLOCK_LFCLKSRC_SRC_Pos);
...
```

title: Fixed typo in incr/decr function
body:
Sorry about the breakage, a last minute change went unnoticed since it only created a warning on GCC.

for #2126

title: stm32 : reduce number of device.h files
body: Now that features (device_has) is defined in targets.json, the device.h file is almost empty and is the same for a complete stm32 family. So we brought it in upper directory for all STM32 families. It reduces the number of files to maintain.

title: Fix issue #2124: IAR no rtos
body: Remove the 2nd call of mbed_sdk_init in __iar_argc_argv

title: [STM32] Serial interrupt TC vs. TXE
body:
Reported in Issue #2119

There was some inconsistency in serial interrupt handling accross STM32
serial_api.c implementation. In case application wants to be notified of
Tx interrupt, it is mainly interested in transmission complete information,
which is the _TC interrupt.

The _TXE (Transmit Data REgister Empty) is used only within driver
in case SERIAL_ASYNCH is being supported to make the transmission
more efficient.

title: [STM32XX] Fix RTC minimum date
Critical - core_util_atomic_decr/incr are undefined
mbed-cli does respect --test-spec
body: micrombed/mbed part of https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-cli/issues/252

title: mbed_sdk_init called twice on IAR without RTOS.
body:
1-mbed_sdk_init is called after __iar_data_init3 (zero initilaized and sdata recopy from flash)
2 mbed_sdk_init is called in __iar_argc_argv : this call can be removed

title: [TARGET_STM] : remove sys.cpp not used in TOOLCHAIN_ARM_MICRO
body: As  the function present in sys.cpp is not used for uARM .  I propose to remove them.

title: Colorized the short Warnings/Errors generated by the toolchains
body:
These commits add colorization to all of the short form Warning and Error messages generated by the compiler when the --color switch is provided on the command line. The default colorization will make Warnings Yellow and Errors Red, but can be changed by the user, in `mbed_settings.py` if they find yellow and red unreadable or ugly.
Affects these top level scripts:
- `build.py`
- `make.py`
- `test.py`

Therefore the mbed subcommands compile, and test are also affected.

title: introduce a context structure to encompass global state in the K64F Storage driver
body:
Together with other minor changes.
This will bring the state of the K64F driver to the point where we can submit a fix for the read-while-write issue in isolation.

@simonqhughes 

follows from https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/2117

Because we failed about test "mbed call before main" in IAR compiler.
Ref:https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/pull/2018#issuecomment-229236123

Regards,

Tomo Yamanaka

title: Interrupts on UART2 (Serial console) on Nucleo-F401
RTOS - Cortex M4 without FPU - fails to compile for ARM
body:
It was fixed for GCC_ARM but we overlooked there is still problem with ARM, originally reported here: https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/issues/612

Error msg:

```
n opcode 'VSTMDBEQ', maybe wrong target CPU?
  167 000000ac  VSTMDBEQ R12!,{S16-S31}
"mbed\\rtos\\rtx\\TARGET_CORTEX_M\\TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7\\TOOLCHAIN_ARM\\HAL_CM4.c", line 187: Error: A1854E: Unknown opcode 'VLDMIANE', maybe wrong target CPU?
  187 000000e0  VLDMIANE R12!,{S16-S31}
"mbed\\rtos\\rtx\\TARGET_CORTEX_M\\TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7\\TOOLCHAIN_ARM\\HAL_CM4.c", line 250: Error: A1854E: Unknown opcode 'VSTMDBEQ', maybe wrong target CPU?
  250 00000136  VSTMDBEQ R12!,{S16-S31}
"mbed\\rtos\\rtx\\TARGET_CORTEX_M\\TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7\\TOOLCHAIN_ARM\\HAL_CM4.c", line 269: Error: A1854E: Unknown opcode 'VLDMIANE', maybe wrong target CPU?
  269 0000016a  VLDMIANE R12!,{S16-S31}
4 Errors, 0 Warnings
C:\Code\git_repo\github\mbed\rtos\rtx\TARGET_CORTEX_M\TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7\TOOLCHAIN_ARM\HAL_CM4.c: 4 warnings, 0 errors
"C:/Code/git_repo/github/mbed/.build/rtos/TARGET_CORTEX_M/rt_HAL_CM.h", line 209: Warning:  #3731-D: intrinsic is deprecated
"C:/Code/git_repo/github/mbed/.build/rtos/TARGET_CORTEX_M/rt_HAL_CM.h", line 212: Warning:  #3731-D: intrinsic is deprecated
"C:/Code/git_repo/github/mbed/.build/rtos/TARGET_CORTEX_M/rt_HAL_CM.h", line 214: Warning:  #3731-D: intrinsic is deprecated
"C:/Code/git_repo/github/mbed/.build/rtos/TARGET_CORTEX_M/rt_HAL_CM.h", line 216: Warning:  #3731-D: intrinsic is deprecated
"mbed\\rtos\\rtx\\TARGET_CORTEX_M\\TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7\\TOOLCHAIN_ARM\\HAL_CM4.c", line 167: Error: A1854E: Unknown opcode 'VSTMDBEQ', maybe wrong target CPU?
  167 000000ac  VSTMDBEQ R12!,{S16-S31}
"mbed\\rtos\\rtx\\TARGET_CORTEX_M\\TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7\\TOOLCHAIN_ARM\\HAL_CM4.c", line 187: Error: A1854E: Unknown opcode 'VLDMIANE', maybe wrong target CPU?
  187 000000e0  VLDMIANE R12!,{S16-S31}
"mbed\\rtos\\rtx\\TARGET_CORTEX_M\\TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7\\TOOLCHAIN_ARM\\HAL_CM4.c", line 250: Error: A1854E: Unknown opcode 'VSTMDBEQ', maybe wrong target CPU?
  250 00000136  VSTMDBEQ R12!,{S16-S31}
"mbed\\rtos\\rtx\\TARGET_CORTEX_M\\TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7\\TOOLCHAIN_ARM\\HAL_CM4.c", line 269: Error: A1854E: Unknown opcode 'VLDMIANE', maybe wrong target CPU?
  269 0000016a  VLDMIANE R12!,{S16-S31}
4 Errors, 0 Warnings
```

Fix:

```
diff --git a/rtos/rtx/TARGET_CORTEX_M/TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7/TOOLCHAIN_ARM/HAL_CM4.c b/rtos/rtx/TARGET_CORTEX_M/TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7/TOOLCHAIN_ARM/Hindex e1366a0..ee8ff8e 100644
--- a/rtos/rtx/TARGET_CORTEX_M/TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7/TOOLCHAIN_ARM/HAL_CM4.c
+++ b/rtos/rtx/TARGET_CORTEX_M/TARGET_RTOS_M4_M7/TOOLCHAIN_ARM/HAL_CM4.c
@@ -164,7 +164,9 @@ SVC_Handler_Veneer

 SVC_ContextSave
         TST     LR,#0x10                ; is it extended frame?
+#ifdef __FPU_PRESENT
         VSTMDBEQ R12!,{S16-S31}         ; yes, stack also VFP hi-regs
+#endif
         MOVEQ   R0,#0x01                ; os_tsk->stack_frame val
         MOVNE   R0,#0x00
         STRB    R0,[R1,#TCB_STACKF]     ; os_tsk.run->stack_frame = val
@@ -184,7 +186,9 @@ SVC_ContextRestore
         CMP     R0,#0                   ; Basic/Extended Stack Frame
         MVNEQ   LR,#:NOT:0xFFFFFFFD     ; set EXC_RETURN value
         MVNNE   LR,#:NOT:0xFFFFFFED
+#ifdef __FPU_PRESENT
         VLDMIANE R12!,{S16-S31}         ; restore VFP hi-registers
+#endif
         MSR     PSP,R12                 ; Write PSP

 SVC_Exit
@@ -247,7 +251,9 @@ Sys_Switch

         MRS     R12,PSP                 ; Read PSP
         TST     LR,#0x10                ; is it extended frame?
+#ifdef __FPU_PRESENT
         VSTMDBEQ R12!,{S16-S31}         ; yes, stack also VFP hi-regs
+#endif
         MOVEQ   R0,#0x01                ; os_tsk->stack_frame val
         MOVNE   R0,#0x00
         STRB    R0,[R1,#TCB_STACKF]     ; os_tsk.run->stack_frame = val
@@ -266,7 +272,9 @@ Sys_Switch
         CMP     R0,#0                   ; Basic/Extended Stack Frame
         MVNEQ   LR,#:NOT:0xFFFFFFFD     ; set EXC_RETURN value
         MVNNE   LR,#:NOT:0xFFFFFFED
+#ifdef __FPU_PRESENT
         VLDMIANE R12!,{S16-S31}         ; restore VFP hi-regs
+#endif
         MSR     PSP,R12                 ; Write PSP

 Sys_Exit
```

title: avoid Read-While-Write errors
body:
fixes configuration-store/#21: avoid Read-While-Write errors

Refer to https://github.com/ARMmbed/configuration-store/issues/21 for more
background information.

Read-while-write errors may occur when there is a read/fetch on a bank of
internal flash while an erase/program operation to the same bank is active.
A read/fetch against internal flash can arise arbitrarily from program activity.  

The possibility of read-while-write collision errors depends on the application's span
of internal-flash.

In the trivial (and also the default) case when this boundary is set to lie at
the junction between the two banks of internal flash (i.e. BLOCK1_START_ADDR),
there is _no_ possibility of read-while-write. In the more common case, when
the system doesn't reserve all of BLOCK1 for the flash driver, there exists
the possibility of read-while-write.

To avoid this problem for the common case (above), we enforce the following:
- Force synchronous mode of execution in the storage_driver.
- Disable interrupts during erase/program operations. This prevents the
  execution of arbitrary user-code which might access flash.
- Ensure all code and data structures used in the storage driver execute
  out of RAM. Refer to __RAMFUNC which allows for this.

We assume that the build-time parameter `CONFIG_HARDWARE_MTD_START_ADDR` is the boundary between application and this driver. User needs to define this parameter to a value that lies _after_ the end of their application's use of internal flash. This is important.
`CONFIG_HARDWARE_MTD_SIZE` may also need to be updated if `CONFIG_HARDWARE_MTD_START_ADDR` is set.

please review: @kjbracey-arm [you need to review only the commit 7810829; other commits are generic]
cc: @simonqhughes @meriac 

notify: @marcuschangarm @LiyouZhou

title: Add desctructor to PwmOut
body:
Issue #2017 
Here's a proposal for review of ~PwmOut implementation

title: STM32 (At least F401) breaks if Tickers are activated in a global object
body:
See: https://developer.mbed.org/questions/69383/How-can-I-make-mRotaryEncoder-work-on-Nu/ and the answer.

Summarized, if you make a Ticker object in a global object which also activates the Ticker (in this case the RotaryEncoder, which uses the PinDetect library), then after the global objects are initialized it stops functioning, and no future Tickers function. I assume the reason is the mbed override function which set the HAL_tick, which in turns set the Timers after they have already been initialized by the mbed lib before. 

Several options: Such as only initializing it once. Or possibly, although I don't know if that would solve all issues, splitting the init of Tickers and Timers. Or any other way to unfuck it ;).

title: Update the uVisor importer script
body:
Changes:
- The importer script now points to the ARMmbed/uvisor `dev` branch, instead of the `unstable` one.
  - The two branches are identical since EPR.
- The uVisor quick-start guide is now copied over to the `FEATURE_UVISOR` folder to serve as the user-facing readme for uVisor on mbed OS.
- No functional change is included in this PR.

@meriac @0xc0170

title: [bugfix gcc_arm] build+make <-> export project+make: different results
body:
## Problem

when in target.json `"default_build": "small"` is configured and GCC_ARM is used
- build.py+make.py
  - uses linker option --specs=nano.specs
  - macro MBED_RTOS_SINGLE_THREAD is defined
- exporting with project.py + make Makefile
  - doesn't use the linker option --specs=nano.specs
  - doesn't contain macro MBED_RTOS_SINGLE_THREAD
## results with current master branch

```
build.py -m NUCLEO_F303K8 -t GCC_ARM
make.py -m NUCLEO_F303K8 -t GCC_ARM -n MBED_BLINKY
```

Result:

| Module | .text | .data | .bss |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Fill | 31 | 0 | 9 |
| Misc | 12397 | 136 | 607 |
| Subtotals | 12428 | 136 | 616 |

```
project.py -m NUCLEO_F303K8 -i gcc_arm -n MBED_BLINKY -b
make
```

  30004    2212     676   32892    807c MBED_BLINKY.elf

```
project.py -m NUCLEO_F303K8 -i gcc_arm -n MBED_BLINKY
make

arm-none-eabi-size  MBED_BLINKY.elf
   text    data     bss     dec     hex filename

```
build.py -m NUCLEO_F303K8 -t GCC_ARM
make.py -m NUCLEO_F303K8 -t GCC_ARM -n MBED_BLINKY
```

Result:

| Module | .text | .data | .bss |

| Misc | 12397 | 136 | 607 |
| Subtotals | 12428 | 136 | 616 |

make

title: Added proper  definition for NRF51_MICROBIT_B
build.py and test.py report results in all-caps
body:
`build.py` and `test.py` report build successes in all caps, with non-standard prefixes. For example: 

```
Build successes:
  * K64F::GCC_ARM::MBED-BUILD
```

This is problematic for two reasons:
1. These all-caps results do not match the on-disk names of the build targets, which complicates CI.
2. Other tools, such as `mbedgt` expect case sensitive naming on case-sensitive filesystems

title: Hardware flow control support for Serial API
body:
### Description
- Priority: Blocker

SLIP driver uses hardware flow control. mbed OS 3 HAL had hooks for that in the Target HAL for FRDM-K64F. For example:

https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-hal-ksdk-mcu/commit/9bfcfd0572d1835a889779515a3b612262785a46

https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-hal-frdm-k64f/commit/77042cc9453c91957b04e9bd200a2dd928723e5a

For morpheous integration, such changes in HAL are needed. Please look into this.

@0xc0170 @screamerbg @SeppoTakalo

title: Share test discovery logic
body:
This PR addresses #2104 by using the same scanning logic used in the toolchains to discover test cases. Previously this logic was partially duplicated here: https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/master/tools/build_api.py#L956

Now tests under a `TARGET_`, `TOOLCHAIN_`, or `FEATURES_` directory should be correctly ignored.
### Breaking changes

`test.py` did not previously require the `-m` and `-t` arguments (because it was not necessary for listing tests). Both of these are now required, since the tests that are discovered are now dependent on the target and toolchain. This will break the `mbed test --compile-list` command at the moment and would require an update to mbed-cli.

Please review @screamerbg, @0xc0170

title: [Exporter-gcc_arm] do builds from project directory when --source is specified
body:
Also, fix a few bugs along the way:
- python barf when something in features is None

title: Adding .mbedignore for target specific test
body:
This is a temporary measure for #2104. It prevents the test from being discovered by using a `.mbedignore` file (which is currently supported by the test discovery logic).

The correct fix for this issue should be to use the same logic that the build system uses when finding source files for finding tests. When this is implemented, this `.mbedignore` file should be removed.

title: Target-specific test gets compiled for incorrect targets
body:
A target-specific test was added recently: https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/da2a4ccbaeb8218f8f5e97e26b4ebd916be46ccd/hal/targets/hal/TARGET_Silicon_Labs/TARGET_EFM32/TESTS/spi/basic-spi/main.cpp. This came as a part of https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/commit/da2a4ccbaeb8218f8f5e97e26b4ebd916be46ccd.

The test discovery logic does not currently take into account `TARGET_`, `TOOLCHAIN_`, nor `FEATURE_` prefixes when scanning for tests. This is a deficiency as this should not be a special case. It should follow the same behavior as the build system.

cc @akselsm

title: Fix pwmout period
body:
This PR applies the below existing STM32F3 fix to other STM32 families. 
   [STM32F3] Increase the supported period range (#1682)
The fix allows to support and use wider pwmout period range.

While doing the change, I introduce a common header file to avoid duplicate definition of the same structures. This same header file (common_ojects.h) can be later use to bring in even more common definitions.

title: Fix tests with config
body: This PR aims to make custom targets (defined in mbed_app.json) usable with tests.

title: [DISCO_F303VC] : fix build issue
body: With this fix DISCO_F303VC build is passed.

title: [NUCLEO_F303K8] fix MBED_16.
body: On NUCLEO_F303K8, RTC clk is on LSI (no LSE connected)

title: [STM32F3]: fix for uart baudrate.
body:
With ARM compiler (i.e) uart is initialized after bss, and sdata and before the call to mbed_sdk_init
For correct uart behaviour, SystemCoreClock must be updated.

title: [STM32XX] Fix default build
body:
A lot of ST targets are defined with a `default_build: "small"` and a `default_toolchain: "uARM"`. It allow to use only one thread in the RTOS.

This commit make the st targets with less than `64KB` of FLASH use the `small` build and `uARM`. The ones with FLASH >= 64KB use `ARM` and `standard` build.

title: Target STM32F3
body:
These series fixes some tests on STM32 F3, and update the SMT32F3 hal.
With the pull request #2090 , the tests are passed.

title: Fix release targets in the build_release.py
body:
Work in progress to get feedback (some debug output in the code, plus lot of commented code, not up to date with the master branch), I'll rebase based on the review. The idea is to remove hardcoded release targets, and use `targets.json` for it. A target contains `release` flag, by default should be `false`.

@sg- @c1728p9 @bogdanm

title: [STM32Fxx] Add Serial Flow Control
body: The Serial Flow Control has been developed and tested previously on the B96B_F446VE board. This PR is a deployment to other STM32 boards.

title: Install correct version of tools
[STM32XX] Fix timer interrupt handler
body:
Some of the targets use only the flag and some other only the interrupt source to check which channel of the master timer has triggered an interrupt in an interrupt handler.

The flag can be set by hardware even if the interrupt is disable and two interrupt can be enable, for one triggered, in the same handler so we need a double check here.

The major issue is that some `interrupt_x` handler code can be execute even if the `interrupt_x` have been disable.

---

These commits make all of the st targets checking both int source and flag for the master timer.

---

Please merge this after these ones, I will rebase:
- [x] #2077 `NUCLEO_F429ZI`
- [x] #2039 `NUCLEO_F446ZE`

title: SPI: Properly aquire peripheral in constructor
body:
Prevent mismatch between _owner and peripheral configuration. In the previous
implementation, the following code would leave the peripheral in an inconsistent
state:

```
SPI spi1(...);      // _owner is NULL, peripheral config is 1
spi1.transfer(...); // _owner is 1, config is 1
SPI spi2(...);      // _owner is 1, config is 2
spi1.transfer(...)  // 1 thinks it still owns peripheral, doesn't reconfigure
```

@0xc0170

title: TCP socket does not read beyond MSS (Max Segment Size) window.
body:
### Description
- Type: Bug
- Priority: Major
## Bug

TCP socket does not read beyond MSS (Max Segment Size) window.
Sending a big chunk of data e.g. 3KB from a remote host to the target mBED device that exceeds MSS results only in 1460 bytes read which is probably MSS (Max Segment Size).

Happens over TCP, blocking mode with no timeout set.

**mbed-os sha**
(`b4bb088876cb`)

**mbed-cli version**
(`mbed 0.7.13`)

**Expected Behavior**
The `recv` method should read the entire 3KB

**Actual Behavior**
The `recv` method read only 1460B

@jenia81

title: Fix#2089
body:
1st commit fixes a built issue for STM32F3 on IAR. 
With this 1st commit , IAR built is passed, but RTOS_4 (IAR) is failed on  NUCLEO_F303K8  due to issue #2089.
The 2nd commit fixes issue #2089, and RTOS_4 is passed on IAR.

title: set_main_stack incorrect for IAR
body:
For IAR heap is defined  .icf file, a dedicated HEAP block is defined
IAR libc relies on this HEAP block.
GCC_ARM , ARM or uARM is not applicable.
In example , the test RTOS_4 fails on NUCLEO_F303K8 with IAR :
rt_stk_check detects that main_stack Magic is corrupted, 
and  os_error (OS_ERR_STK_OVF) is called

title: Moving aligned call to MBED_ALIGN to fix build
body:
This test has been failing to build for a long time. I changed it to use `MBED_ALIGN` to work across compilers. This test is only built and tested by LPC1768 and it actually fails to pass when ran. Is it still valid or does it need to be updated?

Please review @geky @0xc0170.

title: fpu with single/double precision - bugfix and extension
body:
This is an continuative work of PR #1909 and is a suggestion to discuss the problem of two possible Cortex M7 variants: with single or with double precision fpu. 
- creating new core name Cortex_M7F_DP for targets with a double precision fpu
- adding new core name to arm.py to set compiler/linker flags to a double precision fpu when configured in target.json; current state: every Cortex_M7F is configured with single precision fpu
- up to now: gcc wrote flag for a double precision fpu -> target with STM32F746 crashes when using double variables - mcu has only single precision fpu
  -changing gcc.py to use single precision for Cortex-M7F und double precision for Cortex_M7F_DP
  tested with NUCLEO_F746, NUCLEO_F767 and build.py+make.py and exporting with project.py + compiling/flashing

title: [STM32L0XX] Remove stabilization of the timer
readme - setup instruction should be multiplatform
body:
There was PR updating it #1900, but not multiplatform, just changing it to another platform. Therefore we should either state that those instructions are for windows/unix only or provide for all.

Reference: https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed#setup

title: uVisor: Fix K64F vMPU bug in release mode
body:
This commit updates the uVisor libraries following the following fix:
- ARMmbed/uvisor@767e794 "K64F vMPU: Use the MPU fault address"

The bug made some release builds of the uVisor example halt because of
an imprecise bus fault not correctly handled by uVisor internally.

The change only affects targets where `FEATURE_UVISOR` and
`UVISOR_SUPPORTED` are defined.

@0xc0170 @c1728p9 @sg- 

@meriac

title: mbed_lib.json without name field fails with cryptic error
body:
Add an mbed_lib.json file to a library but don't put in a name field. Building fails with:

```
Building project simple-mbed-client-example (K64F, GCC_ARM)
[ERROR] 'name'
[mbed] ERROR: "python" returned error code 1.
[mbed] ERROR: Command "python -u /Users/janjon01/repos/simple-mbed-client-example/mbed-os/core/tools/make.py -t GCC_ARM -m K64F --source . --build ./.build/K64F/GCC_ARM" in "/Users/janjon01/repos/simple-mbed-client-example"
```

That's very cryptic.

title: Backport fixes from nordic branches:
body:
- enable feature BLE in the targets.json. This fix was done a long time
  ago in the nordic branch. Without it, it is not possible to compile BLE
  examples.
- nrf headers synchronized with the one in BLE implementation. This is a
  short term fix. The nordic branches use a single nrf SDK and does not
  have duplicate headers. Once this branch will be integrated, there will
  be no more issues around duplicate headers.

References for files:
- [targets.json](https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-nordic/blob/nordic_sdk_integration/hal/targets.json#L1130)
- [nrf.h](https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/epr-16.06/features/FEATURE_BLE/ble/targets/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_MCU_NRF51822/nrf51-sdk/source/nordic_sdk/components/device/nrf51.h)
- [nrf51.h](https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/epr-16.06/features/FEATURE_BLE/ble/targets/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_MCU_NRF51822/nrf51-sdk/source/nordic_sdk/components/device/nrf51.h)
- [nrf51_bitfields.h](https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/epr-16.06/features/FEATURE_BLE/ble/targets/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_MCU_NRF51822/nrf51-sdk/source/nordic_sdk/components/device/nrf51_bitfields.h)
- [nrf51_deprecated.h](https://github.com/ARMmbed/mbed-os/blob/epr-16.06/features/FEATURE_BLE/ble/targets/TARGET_NORDIC/TARGET_MCU_NRF51822/nrf51-sdk/source/nordic_sdk/components/device/nrf51_deprecated.h)

title: Build tools may remove entire mbed repo
body:
I know this is not a normal invocation. I found this when fuzzing the command line arguments for one of my PR's:

```
$ python tools/make.py -t gcc_arm -m k64f --source . --build . -p 0 --clean
Building project mbed to faoaou (K64F, GCC_ARM)
[ERROR] [Errno 22] Invalid argument: '.'
$ ls
$ git status
fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git
```

No more mbed repo.
We might want to add a check that prevents this.

title: Progen build tests
body:
I have separated some of the exporter logic in project.py to project_api.py. I did this because I wanted to use some of that functionality in the new build_test script. build_test allows testing of ide builds (currently supports iar, uvision, and uv5) using progen. 

build_test examples:

builds blinky for iar and k64f

```
python build_test.py -i iar -t MBED_BLINKY -m K64F
```

build blinky and Hello World test for all targets on all (supported) ides

```
python build_test.py -t MBED_BLINKY MBED_10
```

builds all tests (current default is just blinky but you can specify more with -t) for all progen targets on all ides 

```
python build_test.py 
```
